You are given a sequence of integers $A$ of length $N$, and two integers $k$ and $p$.  You need to split $A$ into $k$ non-overlapping sub-sequences (parts) such that each part contains at least one element of $A$.  

The score of a sub-sequence is the sum of its elements modulo $p$.  

Find the maximum possible sum of the scores of all $k$ parts. 

Output this maximum sum.

You are given a list of numbers and a target number of groups.  You need to divide the list into these groups so that the sum of the sums of each group (with each sum taken modulo a given number) is as large as possible.  Output the largest possible sum.
